attributes.comment:
The proposed increase in the fees for filing a petition will put many families in
extreme hardship. The cost of International adoption is outrageous as it is without
our government raising the related fees to unproportionate levels.

With this level of service and the current prolonged processing time, I do not feel
that an increase in the fees is warrented. If it came with changes such as a two
week turnaround time or some other benefit, that might be acceptable. However,
as is the current situation I strongly object to the new fees.

The service I received from the US embassy here in Chile was totally irrational and
they treated me in a very rude and obnoxious manner. The center for processing
my adoption was the Lima Peru USCIS office. However since my permanent
residence is in Chile, I needed the US embassy to receive my application and to
do my fingerprints. Those are two very simple procedures. They refused to do
them since they were not processing my adoption. I had to pay the fee to be
fingerprinted which by the way they charged me the proposed $80.00 back in
2005, it took me four months and the intervention of vice consuls in Lima and
Gaunzhou before they would agree to do the fingerprints. They wanted me to travel
to Peru to have them done. Once they agreed to do them, I was forced to wait
almost three weeks before being fingerprinted. That is just completely
unacceptable behavior. A raise in the fees will not make the service any better and
I do not feel that we should have to pay more money to be insulted and treated
badly.

Many families living in the continently US have had very similiar experiences.

Sincerely,

Anna Denton
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anna Denton
